entry.title: Check out what the folks at Denver Alliance for Street Health...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Check out what the folks at Denver Alliance for Street Health Response have going on until 12/19 for their Transforming Safety Summit. Links to events are in original post.

Denver Alliance for Street Health Response

Join us in a couple hours as we share our work and talk about the Transforming Safety Week. This week will have nearly a dozen conversations to bring our work t...ogether with community members and elected officials in Colorado as well as other partners around the country. Check out the full week and links below.

Week of Events:

12/13 7pm Introducing DASHR and Transforming Safety: DASHR introduces its work and discusses what to expect from the Transforming Safety Summit
Event: https://fb.me/e/1YzN9i6hA

12/14 4pm National Perspectives on Transforming Safety: Chicago, Long Island, and Los Angeles are all cities in different stages of creating programs influenced by CAHOOTS and STAR – individuals from each area join DASHR to discuss their work and the potential for non-police alternatives
Event: https://fb.me/e/20O9KDgH0

12/14 5:15pm Douglas County Regional Roundtable: Community members in Douglas County discuss safety and seeking racial justice in their communities.
Event: https://fb.me/e/7ScjNttEl

12/15 11am Jefferson County Regional Roundtable: Community members in Jefferson County discuss safety and seeking racial justice in their communities.
Event: Still updating

12/16 4pm Public Health for Public Safety: A Community Movement to Engage and Heal Crime Survivors: The Public Health for Public Safety Leadership Team with Denver Public Health presents the findings from their survey that collected perspectives from victims of crime.
Event: https://fb.me/e/3hCP8XJ0h

12/17 2pm Behavioral Health Crisis Alternatives: The Vera Institute presents its findings on CAHOOTS and programs inspired by the non-police model. They are joined by DASHR and programs in Portland, Oregon and Olympia, Washington.
Event: https://fb.me/e/3jk684ccJ

12/18 4pm Restorative Approaches in the Criminal Justice System: District Attorneys Beth McCann (Denver) and Michael Dougherty (Boulder) and District Attorney-elect Alexis King discuss restorative justice and alternatives to jail and punishment.
Event: https://fb.me/e/3hZrM4Xyx

12/18 7pm Youth-Led Conversation with Congressman Crow: YAASPA brings community concerns to Representative Jason Crow (CD 6).
Event: https://fb.me/e/Aua06eEC

12/19 12pm Alternatives to Police and Reprioritizing Public Safety: City Council members from different cities in Colorado join DASHR to discuss CAHOOTS, STAR, and public safety.
Event: https://fb.me/e/1nkiARppK

12/20 1pm CHAT Hearing (Denver): The Colorado Blueprint to End Hunger and DASHR host their first CHAT: Community Healing, Action, and Truth Hearing to connect the issue of hunger to safety and systemic violence such as racism and poverty.
Event: https://fb.me/e/2czaD2r6J

See More

entry.title: Celestial Alegría's #Reparations Network --> keep...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Celestial Alegría's #Reparations Network --> keep engaging & contributing!

Celestial Alegría

Community we are so powerful! With your support we have raised $10,000 for the #CelestialAlegria #ReparationsNetwork over the last 6 months! Together we created... a community fund that paid $500 of #Reparations to 20 #Black leaders, artists, healers, organizers and organizations! We are making reparations a reality!!

We were able to meet the current $5,000 goal because @madre.jaguar through their work with @mystic_bazaar will be hosting a Winter Solstice Ritual on December 21st and has generously offered to contribute part of the money raised from that event to the reparations network! For more details on how to participate in that event stay tuned.

I am so honored to be a steward of this effort! I am so in awe of our collective power! I am deeply grateful for each and everyone of you! Thank you!
#DefendBlackLives #BLM #BlackLivesMatter #BlackLiberation #ConfrontAntiBlackness #BlackAndBrownUnity #Solidarity #RacialJustice #CollectiveCare #Joy #Transformation #Healing #LifeCoach #Organizer #Leader #Trainer #Consultant

entry.title: Happy #GivingTuesday! Sanctuary4All Colorado is an immigrant-led...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Happy #GivingTuesday! Sanctuary4All Colorado is an immigrant-led group dedicated to protecting families and improving the lives of Colorado immigrants of all backgrounds. "Founded in 2019 by longtime immigration activist Jeanette Vizguerra, Sanctuary4All works at the intersection of mutual aid and political action. By connecting directly impacted families with caring members of our community we will lift each other up and build a movement to affect positive systemic change for the masses."

You can support our mission at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co committing to a monthly donation via Patreon at Patreon.com/Sanctuary4All or donating to sanctuary-4-all on Venmo. 💕✨

Follow S4All's page to find out about their upcoming Solidarity Meal, tamales by the dozen!

Become a patron of Sanctuary4All today: Get access to exclusive content and experiences on the world’s largest membership platform for artists and creators.

patreon.com

Sanctuary4All is creating support for people directly impacted by deportation | Patreon

Become a patron of Sanctuary4All today: Get access to exclusive content and experiences on the world’s largest membership platform for artists and creators.Become a patron of Sanctuary4All today: Get access to exclusive content and experiences on the world’s largest membership platform for artists and creators.

entry.title: Join the Denver Citizen Oversight Board on Wednesday, December...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Join the Denver Citizen Oversight Board on Wednesday, December 9, 2020 from 6:00-8:00 p.m. for a special presentation from Denver Independent Monitor Nicholas Mitchell on the findings in "The Police Response to the 2020 George Floyd Protests in Denver, an Independent Review." Q&A to follow. Please follow this Zoom link to join the meeting: https://denvergov-org.zoom.us/j/83632903850…

Read the report: https://www.denvergov.org/…/374/docum…/2020GFPReport_OIM.pdf
Media coverag...e:
https://denverite.com/…/police-officers-acted-dangerously-…/

https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-police-protest-indepen…/

See MoreDenver Police’s response to massive racial justice protests this summer lacked adequate records that made it difficult for leaders to evaluate decision-making, the independent monitor found.

denverpost.com

Excessive force, poor communication marred Denver police response to George Floyd protests, independent monitor finds

Denver Police’s response to massive racial justice protests this summer lacked adequate records that made it difficult for leaders to evaluate decision-making, the independent monitor found.Denver Police’s response to massive racial justice protests this summer lacked adequate records that made it difficult for leaders to evaluate decision-making, the independent monitor found.

entry.title: Tomorrow 11/26, many of us will be with loved ones and food,...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Tomorrow 11/26, many of us will be with loved ones and food, remotely or in person. Some of our loved ones will tell the myth of the first Thanksgiving. Some of us will participate in the myth telling. Some will cringe and say nothing. Some will wonder what can be said or done. Tomorrow, the United American Indians of New England will have a 50th National Day of Mourning to commemorate the ability to thrive in insane circumstances, and mourn ancestors and the reality that his...tory is repeating itself even now. https://time.com/5911943/thanksgiving-wampanoag/?amp=true.

On their site http://www.uaine.org/, they talk about the day and post the doc "How you can still support the 2020 National Day of Mourning even if you can't come to Plymouth," which has some great suggestions for sharing this perspective and dispelling myths with loved ones and on social media.

To support locally, please check out the incredible work of Four Winds American Indian Council and the Denver Indian Center and please donate to their organization and their food bank, which has been hit hard by the pandemic. https://www.denverindiancenter.org/our-food-bank

See MoreMany Wampanoag hoped that the 400th anniversary of the Mayflower landing would be a galvanizing event to remind people that they still exist

time.com

Tribe Who Fed the Pilgrims Strives for Survival Amid New Epidemic

Many Wampanoag hoped that the 400th anniversary of the Mayflower landing would be a galvanizing event to remind people that they still existMany Wampanoag hoped that the 400th anniversary of the Mayflower landing would be a galvanizing event to remind people that they still exist

entry.title: Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ DenverBlack Lives Matter 5280#CALLTOACTION We are infuriated. In the midst of an uprising of global...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ DenverBlack Lives Matter 5280

#CALLTOACTION We are infuriated. In the midst of an uprising of global proportions fueled by the worldwide demanding of #justiceforBlacklives, the justice syste...m is still being weaponized against us in real time. With the entire world hyper-focused on racial injustice white supremacists have doubled down in full confidence that they will be protected by the justice department above all else. Boulder DA's Office, 20th Judicial District - DA Michael Dougherty is functioning as a vehicle of white supremacy in his refusal to drop these trumped up charges against this sister after years of enduring vile behaviors like the use of racial slurs against her children. We are in fierce support of Mrs. Jeweldine Kastman and her family, and we demand a full dismissal of all charges against them. Call Da Dougherty’s office and demand he dismiss this case today and everyday until it is done! (720) 470-7871
Boulder County case number 19CR1876
#DefundPolice #DefendBlackLife #AbolishthePolice #AbolitionNOW #BlackLivesMatter #BLM5280 #solidarity
Boulder DA's Office, 20th Judicial District - DA Michael Dougherty

[Image Description: BLM5280 letterhead featuring the BLM5280 skyline logo on a white background with a deep grey border reading the following:
November 11 2020
We, the members of Black Lives Matter 5280, after careful consideration of Mrs. Jeweldine Kastman’s case, believe she has been the victim of prejudice in the criminal justice system. Our core values demand we take personal responsibility for denouncing the kind of discrimination, harassment, and racism Mrs. Kastman has experienced in Boulder County. Further, we believe the District Attorney has a responsibility to the public to reexamine her case through an unbiased lens. We believe that acknowledgment and reconsideration of the implicit biases in this case should lead to the conclusion that the interests of justice require that Mrs. Kastman's case be dismissed.
Mrs. Kastman moved to Colorado just a couple of years ago having never experienced the kind of blatant racism she would encounter from her neighbors here. Through constant harassment of herself and her children, having the police called on her family for just being outside their home, and incessant racial slurs repeatedly directed at them no protective measures by law enforcement were ever taken on the Kastman family’s behalf. In fact, on one occasion Mrs. Kastman’s husband, for attempting to stand up to the neighbors' persecution, was charged with harassment. Unsurprisingly, Mrs. Kastman's husband, a white man, received a deferred prosecution agreement on the harassment charge, a privilege that has not been extended to Mrs. Kastman.
Mrs. Kastman, fed up with her family being subjected to targeted harassment indirectly responded to this discrimination out of frustration. The neighbors again reported her, and she was charged with a Class 3 Felony for Witness Retaliation, which carries anywhere from 4 - 12 years in prison followed by 5 years of parole. Jeweldine does not have a criminal history. Despite her lack of criminal history, the Longmont Police Department bypassed the opportunity to issue a summons to Mrs. Kastman and instead chose to arrest Mrs. Kastman in front of her children.
The DA of Boulder County, Michael Dougherty, is only willing to reduce the charges if Mrs. Kastman pleads guilty to harassment or disorderly conduct. The white men who have habitually berated and antagonized this family in front of their home have never been charged. After years of living in constant fear, and after her husband was charged with harassment for standing up to racists threatening their family, Jeweldine Kastman is being ordered to sacrifice her freedom or plead guilty to a crime she did not commit. In September of 2019, DA Michael Dougherty’s office announced their commitment to prosecute instances of bias and hate motivated crimes “to the full extent of the law.” How is it that just one year later we’re being called to action against an obvious display of bias and hate in Boulder County that is being enabled by the DA himself? We do not stand for this. We stand firmly in support of Mrs. Jeweldine Kastman and her family, and we demand a full dismissal of this case and that the harassment conviction her husband received for verbally defending his family be overturned immediately. We demand that DA Michael Dougherty honor his commitment to the people of Boulder County and interrupt this perpetual cycle of bias in our justice department. This family had law enforcement sworn to serve and protect them weaponized against them at a time
when they feared for their lives. We demand justice. Black Lives Matter 5280.]

See More

entry.title: Seeking your contributions to Celestial Alegría’s...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Seeking your contributions to Celestial Alegría’s #ReparationsNetwork right now! Please share with your networks today & tomorrow🧡

Celestial Alegría

So far the #CelestialAlegria #ReparationsNetwork has raised $2,225 from your generous community support towards the goal of $5,000 by Saturday, November 14th!

...Although we are shy of our goal currently, I know that together we will organize the money needed to make $500 to all of the 10 incredible Black leaders, organizers, healers, artists and organizations currently receiving this community funded resource!

How you can be a part:
1. Give via Venmo @Celeste-Martinez-129 or PayPal.Me/CelestialAlegria and put reparations in the comments
2. Share about this work with 5 people you know
3. Educate yourself on why reparations are important

To all who have contributed so far, thank you for taking action with your money! To all who have been sharing and amplifying this work thank you! It takes each and everyone of us to create the systems of collective care we need to thrive!

#DefendBlackLives #BLM #BlackLivesMatter #BlackLiberation #ConfrontAntiBlackness #BlackAndBrownUnity #Solidarity #RacialJustice #CollectiveCare #Joy #Transformation #Healing #LifeCoach #Organizer #Leader #Trainer #Consultant

entry.title: 📣Call To Action📣 Contact Your Denver City Council people...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

📣Call To Action📣

Contact Your Denver City Council people (including At-Large - Ortega & Kniech) and ask:

• What is the status of collective bargaining with Denver Police Dept?...
• Will you commit to allow the police contract to go to arbitration?
• Will you commit to no raises for DPD?

DEMAND - no new raises for Denver Police Department!

A 2-year contract with DPD is not just irresponsible, it is immoral. The current contract allows DPD to lock in a $5M raise in 2022 while no other city employees are allowed to collectively bargain AND face drastic cuts to their agency budgets. The 2021 budget includes minor increases to programs designed as alternatives to policing (STAR, etc.) with funding from external sources – these budgetary increases did not decrease the DPD budget in any way.

Tell your councilperson to stand firm and say NO to this contract!

[image:

-Kniech, At Large 720-337-7712 kniechatlarge@denvergov.org. @KniechAtLarge

entry.title: Yessenia Martinez is selling tamales & soups this upcoming...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Yessenia Martinez is selling tamales & soups this upcoming weekend! Pickup in Denver, Aurora, and Boulder on November 14 between 1 and 3 PM. Order form: tinyurl.com/solidarity-meals-11-14. Venmo: @Yessenia-Martinez-25

Yessenia has been involved with Sanctuary4All Colorado for the past 2 years and is currently on the S4All board of directors. All funds go to her husband's immigration case. Yessenia is doing this all while raising two small children - and as anyone who has purc...hased a solidarity meal from her before knows, her cooking is delicious!

[image: tamales by the half dozen for $12 - 100% authentic Mexican tamales. Verdes con pollo (filled with salsa verde and chicken), rojos con puerco (salsa roja and pork), rajas con queso (jalapeño and cheese). second image: soups 32 oz for $12 - gluten free. Caldo de pollo (chicken soup with chicken thigh, potato, carrot, rice, and chayote. Sopa de verduras (vegetable soup with corn, carrot, potato, and celery.] Showing Up For Racial Justice - SURJ Boulder SURJ (Showing Up for Racial Justice) Families of Boulder County

See MoreSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Yessenia is selling tamales and soup for the family next weekend! She’s been involved with Sanctuary4All for over about two years now, is on the board of direct...ors, and has sold pupusas for #SolidarityMeals a few times before. She’s raising money to support her husband’s immigration case. You can place an order at tinyurl.com/solidarity-meals-11-14.

entry.title: Today, we are of course relieved that an openly racist,...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Today, we are of course relieved that an openly racist, misogynistic fascist was voted out of the Presidency by the American people, but disappointed in the overwhelming numbers of white Americans who believe the current administration is what is best for this country. We also hold close the reality that if we are to continue the fight for racial justice, we must work harder than ever to hold the Biden-Harris administration, Congress, the Supreme Court, our state and local go...vernments, our neighbors, and our families accountable to the leadership of Black, Brown, and Indigenous communities, most notably the Black women and femmes who, despite their tireless work toward liberation, will be the most adversely affected by harmful policy decisions inevitably to come.

It will also take a tremendous amount of effort to work toward repairing the damage that centuries of racism has caused in this country, let alone that which has been concentrated within the past four years. Our work won’t get easier, it will just look different. We are as committed as always to amplifying the work of Black, Brown, and Indigenous community leaders, and we will never stop striving toward a more antiracist world. We hope you’ll do the same.

See More

entry.title: It's a great day to PAY BLACK WOMXN AND FEMMES. Contribute...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

It's a great day to PAY BLACK WOMXN AND FEMMES. Contribute now. Contribute again tomorrow. Share with your networks.

Celestial Alegría

Pay Black Womxn and Femmes! Make reparations now!

It is no coincide that all of the current #CelestialAlegria #Reparations recipients are Black Womxn and Femmes.... To learn more about each of these incredible Black leaders, healers, artists and organizers go to www.celestialalegria.com/reparations-network

And, be a part of this opportunity to create a system of collective care! I am grateful to have already raised $2,000 because of your generosity, and my goal is to raise $5,000 by November 15th. If I raise more than that amount I will absolutely pay further reparations to more members of our beautiful Black community. But before we get there, I need to show up for the current recipients today!

How you can take action:
Give at Venmo @Celeste-Martinez-129 or PayPal.Me/CelestialAlegria
Share this video with your people
Listen to Black Womxn and Femmes and how they are calling you to take action

https://youtu.be/_cPymDwRqIo

entry.title: Denver Police Department, the Department of Public Safety, and...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Denver Police Department, the Department of Public Safety, and Denver City Council Districts 5 & 8 (represented by Councilpersons Sawyer and Herndon) are holding a meeting “to discuss safety and crime in the East Colfax Neighborhood” today - Thursday, November 5th at 5:30 PM on Facebook and Zoom (Zoom registration link here: https://us02web.zoom.us/…/register/WN_YK1tzg48QPez5snL9Di1rg).

Meetings like this, as well as Registered Neighborhood Organizations (RNOs) and DPD Citize...ns’ Advisory Boards are phenomenal opportunities to make our voices heard and advocate for alternatives to policing and disinvestment from policing/investment in community-based programs.

You can:
•Speak up for our unhoused neighbors (who are disproportionately BIPOC) who are harassed and “swept” by police and city agencies repeatedly, have their property confiscated or destroyed, all in violation of CDC guidance to allow homeless encampments to stand because shelters are vectors for transmission of COVID.
•Advocate for continued expansion of programs like STAR (Support Team Action Response) that divert police from 911 calls that involve mental health crises, substance abuse, or people who need connections to services.
•Redirect and question neighbors/attendees who advocate for increased police presence in neighborhoods (see above for alternative solutions).
•Encourage people to engage with neighbors and community members directly in non-emergency situations rather than calling 911.

Do NOT use this to communicate with DPD or the city in ways that could increase policing in the neighborhood. Even if it might seem innocuous (i.e. complaining that your neighbors play loud music late at night) it can make neighbors (particularly BIPOC, unhoused, etc. folks) more vulnerable to police violence.

See MoreWelcome! You are invited to join a webinar: East Colfax Community Safety Meeting. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the webinar.

us02web.zoom.us

entry.title: White folks who are taking to the streets in solidarity, are...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

White folks who are taking to the streets in solidarity, are your actions and decisions centering Black, Indigenous, and People of Color? This document provides guidance on how to prioritize the vision of BIPOC organizers, tips for keeping safe during actions, and direction for white accomplices acting in a security/marshal role. This document also includes BIPOC led organizations doing amazing work in Colorado.

https://bit.ly/2Mnw0Nd

[image: screen background with white le...
